item.title: Metals Steady as Prospect of Further Fed Rate Hikes Rises
item.description: Base metal prices held stead while gold ticked higher, as the prospect of further rate hikes from the Fed and weak demand in China put pressure on prices.

item.title: Crude Oil Steady as Worries Over China Demand Hit Sentiment
item.description: Crude oil prices were steady, with worries over Chinese demand outweighing supply tightness concerns.

item.title: Intel Scraps Tower Acquisition After China Fails to Approve Deal
item.description: Intel had agreed in February 2022 to buy the Israeli chip maker for more than $5 billion.

item.title: Aviva Upgrades Outlook After Strong First Half
item.description: Aviva said it expects to exceed its midterm targets after it reported a first-half operating profit of £715 million, ahead of guidance and analysts’ expectations.

item.title: Tesla Lowers Prices for Model S and Model X in China
item.description: Tesla has cut the prices for Model S and Model X cars in its inventory in China, two days after it slashed prices of its Model Y series.

item.title: Sterling Rises After UK Inflation Data
item.description: Sterling rose after data showed U.K. core inflation remained at 6.9% in July, high enough to suggest the BOE will raise interest rates further.

item.title: Carlsberg Tops Views on Asia Strength
item.description: Carlsberg posted first-half adjusted earnings of DKK4.8 billion, with volume growth driven by Asia and its premium brand portfolio.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows in July, but Still a Worry
item.description: The annual rate of inflation slowed but it may not be falling fast enough to convince the Bank of England to pause interest rate increases.

item.title: UK Inflation Falls More Than Expected; Core Rate Steady
item.description: Consumer prices were 6.8% higher in July, easing from June, but with core inflation unchanged, the pressure remains on the BOE as it considers another interest-rate hike next month.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.5%, Dragged by Trading Houses, Banks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in trading houses and banks as concerns about higher borrowing costs cast a shadow over the economic outlook.

item.title: HKEX's First-Half Net Profit Rose 31%
item.description: Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing’s first-half profit rose 31%, supported by increased net investment income due to higher interest rates.

item.title: TSG, which helped finance hits including "Avatar: The Way of Water" and the "Deadpool" franchise for Twentieth Century Fox, sued the studio and its Disney parent for breach of contract.
item.description: TSG, which helped finance hits including “Avatar: The Way of Water” and the “Deadpool” franchise for Twentieth Century Fox, sued the studio and its Disney parent for breach of contract.

item.title: The UAW said labor negotiations with the Detroit automakers have been sluggish and the union would hold a strike authorization vote next week.
item.description: The UAW said labor negotiations with the Detroit automakers have been sluggish and the union would hold a strike authorization vote next week.

item.title: The Missouri Supreme Court upheld a law that allows parents to be jailed if their children don't attend school regularly, which the court defined as every day class is in session.
item.description: The Missouri Supreme Court upheld a law that allows parents to be jailed if their children don’t attend school regularly, which the court defined as every day class is in session.

item.title: British police arrested five people, including at least three Bulgarian nationals, believed to have been living undercover in the U.K. while working for Russian intelligence.
item.description: British police arrested five people, including at least three Bulgarian nationals, believed to have been living undercover in the U.K. while working for Russian intelligence.

item.title: Americans boosted their retail spending last month at the fastest pace since the start of the year, as consumers continue to bolster the resilient U.S. economy.
item.description: Americans boosted their retail spending last month at the fastest pace since the start of the year, as consumers continue to bolster the resilient U.S. economy.

item.title: Neuroscientists reconstructed a classic rock song from recordings of the brain activity of 29 patients who had heard it while undergoing brain surgery.
item.description: Neuroscientists reconstructed a classic rock song from recordings of the brain activity of 29 patients who had heard it while undergoing brain surgery.

item.title: A former high-level FBI counterintelligence agent pleaded guilty to accepting secret payments from Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.
item.description: A former high-level FBI counterintelligence agent pleaded guilty to accepting secret payments from Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.

item.title: A wild swing in government-bond yields weighed on U.S. stock indexes, helping to depress the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow by 1.2%, 1.1% and 1%, respectively. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note ended at 4.220%.
item.description: A wild swing in government-bond yields weighed on U.S. stock indexes, helping to depress the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow by 1.2%, 1.1% and 1%, respectively. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note ended at 4.220%.

item.title: Private jet membership company Wheels Up reached a deal to receive a $500 million rescue financing package from Delta and investors with turnaround experience, the airline said.
item.description: Private jet membership company Wheels Up reached a deal to receive a $500 million rescue financing package from Delta and investors with turnaround experience, the airline said.
